fields.description:
Since we have currently 9 remote agents running and are expecting the Enterprise licence (25 remote agents licenced) in a few days: it is quite a time consumptive operation to replace all Bamboo agent jar files on all of our VMware virtual machines manually.

It would be helpful if the remote agents or their service wrappers could update the remote agent jar file to a new Bamboo version. This should be triggered from the Admin web GUI.
fields.summary: Admin command to let remote agents or the service wrappers update the bamboo-agent.jar file

fields.description:
according to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+Remote+Agent+Installation+Guide agents can be installed as service on windows OS

with java -jar atlassian-bamboo-agent-installer-2.2.1.jar http://bamboo-host-server:8085/agentServer installntservice

the command that follows

java -jar atlassian-bamboo-agent-installer-2.2.1.jar http://bamboo-host-server:8085/agentServer start

to bring up the agent does not start the agent
{panel}
INFO   | wrapper  | 2009/04/07 10:37:38 | Waiting to start...
STATUS | wrapper  | 2009/04/07 10:37:38 | Launching a JVM...
INFO   | jvm 3    | 2009/04/07 10:37:39 | Wrapper (Version 3.2.3) http://wrapper.tanukisoftware.org
INFO   | jvm 3    | 2009/04/07 10:37:39 |   Copyright 1999-2006 Tanuki Software, Inc.  All Rights Reserved.
INFO   | jvm 3    | 2009/04/07 10:37:39 |

INFO   | jvm 3    | 2009/04/07 10:37:39 | Requesting fingerprintRequestUrl: %BAMBOO_SERVER%/GetFingerprint.action?hostName=asahi.sydney.atlassian.com
INFO   | jvm 3    | 2009/04/07 10:37:39 | Exiting due to fatal exception.
INFO   | jvm 3    | 2009/04/07 10:37:39 | java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid uri '%BAMBOO_SERVER%/GetFingerprint.action?hostName=asahi.sydney.atlassian.com': Invalid URL encoding
{panel}
fields.summary: Cannot start remote agent other than console on windows

fields.description:
If the author name of a commit contains characters like "<" or ">" the resulting ajax response is wrong.

Example when requesting:
http://bamboo.int/api/rest/getLatestBuildResults.action?auth=XXXXXXXXX&buildKey=GM-STG

The result is:

<response>
    <projectName>Gamersmafia</projectName>
    <buildName>Staging</buildName>
    <buildKey>GM-STG</buildKey>
    <buildState>Failed</buildState>
    <buildNumber>13</buildNumber>
    <failedTestCount>1</failedTestCount>

    <successfulTestCount>804</successfulTestCount>
    <buildTime>2009-03-22 19:01:39</buildTime>
    <buildCompletedDate>2009-03-22T19:03:42+0100</buildCompletedDate>
    <buildDurationInSeconds>123</buildDurationInSeconds>
    <buildDurationDescription>2 minutes</buildDurationDescription>
    <buildRelativeBuildDate>1 week ago</buildRelativeBuildDate>

    <buildTestSummary>1 out of 805 failed</buildTestSummary>
    <buildReason>Code has changed</buildReason>

    <commits>
                <commit author="slnc <s@slnc.me>" />
                <commit author="slnc <s@slnc.me>" />
                <commit author="slnc <s@slnc.me>" />
                <commit author="slnc <s@slnc.me>" />
                <commit author="slnc <s@slnc.me>" />
                <commit author="slnc <s@slnc.me>" />
                <commit author="slnc <s@slnc.me>" />
                <commit author="slnc <s@slnc.me>" />
                <commit author="slnc <s@slnc.me>" />
                <commit author="slnc <s@slnc.me>" />
                <commit author="slnc <s@slnc.me>" />
    </commits>
</response>

But the commit lines should be:

                <commit author="slnc <s@slnc.me>" />
fields.summary: AuthorName is not html escaped when serving Ajax responses

fields.description: When Bamboo server does not respond to heartbeat elastic agent does not finish - it tries to reach server and all subsequent heartbeat coall are cancelled as first on is in progress.
fields.summary: Elastic agent does not exit on communication error

fields.description:
If ldap is enabled in atlassian-user.xml but the connection is faulty :
* Users can still log in (if they have a local account and group membership)
* The admin > Users and > Group lists are empty
* Searching for a user works and the (local) user is is found.

Bamboo should reliably fall back to the local repository content in case the external one become unavailable.
fields.summary: faulty external user repository connection causes EMPTY user and group lists

fields.description:
There are lots of different test runs in our acceptance tests now e.g regular, remote agent, sal integration

We should be able to have the properties in one profile but keep everything that is common (e.g. the cargo stuff) in a shared profile. 
That way it's much easier to see what's _different_ between the different set ups.
fields.summary: Refactor Acceptance Test Pom

http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+SAL+Compatability+-+Work+In+Progress
fields.summary: Implement SAL Interfaces Part 3

fields.description:
The multipart emails must handle encoding different to the old text emails.

The text "Māris Gabaliņš" will not render correctly in the multipart emails (both html and text parts) but does in the straight text emails.
Not sure why this is happening but we should be able to manually set the encoding of the emails.
fields.summary: Character Encoding for new Multipart Emails is incorrect

fields.description:
users need to turn on ldap caching otherwise bamboo does not pick up changes unless it is restarted
(2:43 PM) ukuhnhardt: this needs to be clear in the first place otherwise they get excited, play with groups and users in LDAP and bamboo is not picking up the changes
fields.summary: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Integrating+Bamboo+with+LDAP has no refernece to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Configuring+the+Caching+of+your+LDAP+Repository

fields.description:
The "View" link on the JDKs & Builders page is for viewing the JDK / Builder as a whole (that is across the various agents). However, it appears next to all the agent rows. Other operations like renaming the capability doesn't appear at all.

We should change the UI so that the first row of a new Label has the "global" operations like View & Rename, making it much less confusing for the user

!skitched-20090402-121737.png!
fields.summary: Making Rename link available on JDK & Builder pages

fields.description:
Recently we were able to improve the build time for Confluence functional tests by increasing the -Xmx allocated to the test runner to prevent excessive GC slowing the bill.

Discovering this GC overhead was a manual process requiring someone to notice the build was running long and then using a combination of unix tools and jstat to figure out what the problem was.

It struck me that this is something the bamboo agent could do itself, by monitoring the target VM via JMX.
fields.summary: Bamboo should monitor build jvm GC usage

fields.description:
The XML response looks like so:

{code}
<response vcsRevisionKey="31925">
<commits>
<commit author="jjaroczynski" date="2009-04-01T00:48:35-0500">
<comment>PL-1323: checkstyle</comment>
<files>
<file name="/PL/trunk/atlassian-intellij-connector/src/main/java/com/atlassian/theplugin/idea/jira/IssuesToolWindowPanel.java" revision="31905"/>
</files>
</commit>
<commit author="pmaruszak" date="2009-04-01T03:39:38-0500">
<comment>
PL-1289 - User can select an issue as the active issue
</comment>
<files>
<file name="/PL/trunk/atlassian-intellij-connector/src/main/java/com/atlassian/theplugin/idea/action/issues/activetoolbar/AbstractActiveJiraIssueAction.java" revision="31925"/>
</files>
</commit>
<commit author="jjaroczynski" date="2009-04-01T00:36:52-0500">
<comment>PL-1323: line wrap fix</comment>
<files>
<file name="/PL/trunk/atlassian-intellij-connector/src/main/java/com/atlassian/theplugin/idea/jira/ChangesetCreate.java" revision="31898"/>
<file name="/PL/trunk/atlassian-intellij-connector/src/main/java/com/atlassian/theplugin/idea/jira/ChangesetCreate.form" revision="31898"/>
</files>
</commit>
</commits>
<failedTests>
    </failedTests>
<successfulTests>
... etc
{code}

Note that we have revision number for individual files, and some number called " vcsRevisionKey" which is per-build, instead of per changeset

Because of this problem we are not able to provide a link to a fisheye view of the whole changeset in the IntelliJ Connector's view of the build
fields.summary: REST API returns only one VCS revision for the build, even if multiple changesets are contained in the build
Builder dropdown should be sorted
Update various Common modules

fields.description: I've just visited bamboo.developer.atlassian.com using IE 7 and it was unusably slow.  It happily consumed an entire CPU constantly. It's fine on other browsers though.
fields.summary: Dashboard with many projects performs very poorly in Internet Explorer

fields.description:
Freemarker has a feature to format the date/time http://freemarker.sourceforge.net/docs/ref_builtins_date.html
This feature should be used in all templates. A global setting should define the format string.
fields.summary: Bamboo should have configurable date time format

fields.description:
* It would be very useful if we could define priorities on our build plans.
 As an example, we have 2 types of build plans, one to compile and launch the tests and one to create a maven release.
 With a top priority field on our build plan of type release, a build newly launched would be placed directly on top of build plans already in the queue but with a minor priority.

 * -A manual reordering of the queue could be useful too-, implemented in Bamboo 2.3, see BAM-2503
fields.summary: Priorities on build plan

fields.description:
It could be interesting to classify our build plans by labels.
example : group all nightly build plan together
fields.summary: Labels on build plan

fields.description: /opt//opt/maven-2.0 is wrong path
fields.summary: Wrong defined M2_HOME for elastic bamboo image

fields.description:
A firewall between Bamboo and the company network including mail servers causes Outlook to hang when rendering image links in email notifications.
Outlook would attempt to render the message and hang..
I worked around the issue by removing the links to the images in the notification template.
fields.summary: A firewall between Bamboo and the company network including mail servers causes Outlook to hang when rendering image links in email notifications

fields.description: Implement a global admin setting to control the email format.  This setting should override the personal settings of users. A warning should be displayed in the user's profile page that the global setting is 'xxx'
fields.summary: Global Admin Setting to control email format

fields.description: After building in Bamboo, we do a manual job by tagging in SVN with a tag corresponding to the Maven2 version (tagging with 2.0.5 if the version in Maven2 pom.xml is <version>2.0.5</version>). We would like to automate this process, and are looking at trying out the Bamboo Tagger Plugin (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMEXT/Bamboo+Tagger+plugin). As the Tagger Plugin can use Build-specific variables, it would be really useful is we can get the version from maven, similar to how you get the revision number from SVN (custom.svn.revision.number).
fields.summary: Build-Specific variable for Maven2 version

fields.description:
We've made a few changes which cause small breakages in Bamboo. Attached is a patch with the required changes:

- ILuceneConnection.SearcherAction.perform() is now void, rather than returning a boolean
- ILuceneConnection.leakSearcher() is deprecated and should not be used.

Some additional changes that Chris and I strongly recommend if you want to improve your Bonnie integration:

- remove Bamboo's LuceneConnectionImpl and LuceneConnection classes -- they are redundant now because the index is automatically created, and you should use withSearcher() rather than leakSearcher() and closeQuietly().
- rather than extending ConcurrentLuceneConnection, just create a new instance using the constructor
- don't use HighestBuildNumberCollector but instead use Lucene's sort to find out the highest build number. Lucene's sort uses a field cache instead of reading the build number from the index every time (and you can throw away that extra class)
- add a SearcherInitialisation to warm up the index searcher for the sort.

We're happy to help you get this integrated; we'd like to keep both products on recent versions of the library.
fields.summary: Upgrade Bamboo to Bonnie 3.2

fields.description:
We need some way to allow clean up of remote agents after a build. This will have to happen after the artifact transfer back to the server. Right now, the artifact transfer module is also implemented as a post build command, hence there is no guarantee that any "clean up" process happens after that.

We should have a new plugin point that is after artifact transfer on the remote agent.
fields.summary: Allow a command to run for cleanup on remote agent after artifact transfer

fields.description: All the CTK testing plugin does is generic testing that the interfaces return something.   We need to write some Bamboo specific tests which ensure Bamboo is actually doing the right thing underneath those SAL calls.
fields.summary: Bamboo Specfic Functional Tests for SAL Intefaces

fields.description: When the build ends, bamboo sweeps up the artifacts.  I'd like a system property on the agent which could introducce a small sleep.  This would be to allow the build to settle down and save all its artifacts before the agent comes along to collect them.
fields.summary: Add the ability to sleep before collecting artifacts to a bamboo agent

fields.description:
Recently there were a few support requests regarding bamboo upgrade and rollout of new agent versions.

Remote Agent Wrapper should check for agent / server version conflicts and warn about conflicts. IDEALLY the agent wrapper would 
* kill the current agent process
* download the compatible agent version from the server
* restart the agent using customizations such as bamboo.home that were used for the previous version of the agent.

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-1637
fields.summary: Remote Agent Wrapper should check for agent / server version conflicts
Fix the thing
Reproduce issue

fields.description: Apparently when the bamboo master is restarted (which can either happen for a scheduled reason like a plugin upgrade, or because the JVM borked and it is restarted by contegix or a monitoring tool) then any Elastic Agents spawned from this instance will not die, and will live on, uncontactable until they are shutdown manually.
fields.summary: Elastic agents do not automatically shut down if the Bamboo server is restarted

fields.description:
When you upgrade Bamboo when you license is expired, no upgrade tasks are run, instead you get an error which prevents you from proceeding until you update your licences.

When updating your license, there is a hook which will check details of elastic  bamboo and update them based on the license.  
However, because none of the upgrade tasks have been run yet there is not database tables available to get this information from and
hence you get the stack trace below.

These exceptions do not actually prevent you from updating the license (it just looks like it does), so a restart will resolve the state of your bamboo instance.

{code}
org.springframework.jdbc.BadSqlGrammarException: Hibernate operation: Could not execute query; bad SQL grammar []; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: Table not found in statement [select elasticima0_.ELASTIC_IMAGE_ID as ELASTIC_1_, elasticima0_.AMI_IMAGE_ID as AMI_IMAG2_, elasticima0_.CAPABILITY_SET as CAPABILI3_ from ELASTIC_IMAGE elasticima0_]
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Table not found in statement [select elasticima0_.ELASTIC_IMAGE_ID as ELASTIC_1_, elasticima0_.AMI_IMAGE_ID as AMI_IMAG2_, elasticima0_.CAPABILITY_SET as CAPABILI3_ from ELASTIC_IMAGE elasticima0_]

	at net.sf.hibernate.hql.QueryTranslator.list(QueryTranslator.java:854)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.find(SessionImpl.java:1554)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.QueryImpl.list(QueryImpl.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao$2.doInHibernate(HibernateObjectDao.java:97)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.execute(HibernateTemplate.java:370)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.executeFind(HibernateTemplate.java:341)
	at com.atlassian.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao.findAllSorted(HibernateObjectDao.java:90)
	at com.atlassian.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao.findAll(HibernateObjectDao.java:78)

fields.description:
Since upgrading to 2.2, the "Failing Since Build" indications on an individual build result's main page appear to be wrong.  Prior to 2.1, it would list the build the actual test failed in.  Since 2.2, it just the first failed build (since the last succesfull build).  For example, see: http://build.limewire.org/bamboo/browse/LW-COMPONENTS-1986 .  That says that in the  XmppFriendSubscriptionTest suite, the Friend request denied test was failing since LW-COMPONENTS-1984.  But, if you look at http://build.limewire.org/bamboo/browse/LW-COMPONENTS-1984, that test didn't fail -- a different one did.  If you look at http://build.limewire.org/bamboo/browse/LW-COMPONENTS-1985 (the build in between the two), that is where the test failed.

Because Bamboo doesn't tell you where the actual test failed anymore (it definitely used to do this), it's very hard to prioritize which tests to fix.  We used to glance at it and say, "Oh, that's been failing for a month -- let's take a look at it.  These others only failed last night, it might have been a fluke."  

This is a very major regression in functionality IMO.
fields.summary: Failing Since Wrong Build #

fields.description:
Recently for many customers build expiry did not work because of foreign key constraint violation:
mainly for table user_commit.

{code}
Hibernate operation: could not delete: com.atlassian.bamboo.resultsummary.BuildResultsSummaryImpl#11042858; SQL []; Cannot delete or update a parent row: a foreign key
 constraint fails (`bamboo/user_commit`, CONSTRAINT `FKF8936C2BA958B29F` FOREIGN KEY (`BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_ID`) REFERENCES `buildresultsummary
` (`BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_ID`)); nested exception is com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.MySQLIntegrityConstraintViolationException: Cannot delete or update a parent row: a 
foreign key constraint fails (`bamboo/user_commit`, CONSTRAINT `FKF8936C2BA958B29F` FOREIGN KEY (`BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_ID`) REFERENCES 
`buildresultsummary` (`BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_ID`))
{code}
fields.summary: Expire builds throws SQLIntegrityConstraintViolationException

fields.description:
After doing a 30,000 ft. eval of several CI products (Hudson, TeamCity, Cruise, Bamboo, and CruiseControl.net) we chose Cruise and Bamboo as the most promising of the bunch, so we installed both products internally and gave them a test drive.
 
Both products are really good, but what sealed the deal for us was the notion of a pipeline.  That concept really appeals to us and we see a lot of promise in that.  We implemented a similar process using multiple Plans in a Project, but it just wasn't as natural, Bamboo seemed to flow best with the single "event" (compile, test, coverage, deploy) instead of separate plans for each event, that chaining (or pipeline in Cruise-lingo) is a 1st level concept in Cruise.
 
We did like the added information and reporting, but ultimately we felt the stats wouldn't help in day to day management of the product.  It seems to us that information like "how often does Joe commit a failing build" is more suited to Human Resources than managing a product.  The unit test history was intriguing, but with 100's or 1000's of tests, it seemed more noise than anything beneficial.
 
We did have a tough time with the decision because some of the features of Cruise are, at this point, only promises (due to the newness of the product).  But like I said, in the end it was the notion of the pipeline that sealed the deal for us.
 
Thanks!

Lee
Lee.Tan@qg.com
fields.summary: Pipeline for Bamboo

fields.description:
When a remote agents goes offline, its entry in the admin>agents list stays; when I manually delete it, all its history is removed. 
Offline remote agents should be listed in another screen that is dedicated to their history similar to the admin > elastic bamboo>  agent history screen. 
Offline remote agents should disappear from the agent list but still maintain the history. 

Created from https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-1640
fields.summary: Remote Agents that are offline should go into a separate screen to avoid cluttering the admin>agents screen

fields.description:
Many projects using Subversion avoid svn:externals and instead use sparse directories that came with svn 1.5

svn co --depth=files http://svn.example.com/software/trunk
svn update trunk/my_project trunk/shared

This way developers get a smaller working set of files but one that behaves correctly.

Generally, more advanced options for how a set of files is monitored and checked out would be very helpful.
fields.summary: Make checkouts smaller by supporting sparse directories

fields.description:
When the most recent build occured less than one second ago, the Bamboo REST API returns data such as this:

 <buildRelativeBuildDate>< 1 second ago</buildRelativeBuildDate>

which is not valid markup.  The < should be escaped.
fields.summary: Build results REST XML invalid

fields.description: com.atlassian.bamboo/atlassian-acceptance-test.jar is an empty jar because all the classes in it are in the test directory.  But some of its classes, eg, BuildHelper, would be incredibly useful for plugin developers to use when they are writing their own functional tests.  Either all the classes should be moved into the main directory, or the helpful ones for plugin developers like BuildHelper should be stripped out so that they can be used.  This would make BAM-3662 slightly less painful to deal with.
fields.summary: Make Acceptance test utility classes available for plugin developers

fields.description:
Writing automated UI tests for plugins is very easy for products that support import without restarting the application, between each test you can do an import and then you're guaranteed to have a clean new instance of the app, no need to worry about cleaning up after yourself, creation of test data is very fast and simple.

Bamboo doesn't support this.  I'm not sure how Bamboo's web tests ensure that dirty data isn't carried between tests, but if you've written a simple plugin that just requires one build plan to be set up in a particular way, you're not going to want to have to write 50 lines of code that go and click through Bamboo's build plan creation process, and then write more code to delete it all at the end of each test, so that you can write a few lines of code to test your plugin.  You just want to create your test dataset, and then write a simple bit of code that imports that data.

I understand that Bamboo has a lot setup and running in the background, and that an import has the potential to cause everything to go crazy, but in a functional test scenario, you have control over everything that's happening, you can ensure that there are no remote agents, no builds running, no repository polling etc.  Even if there's a hidden importWithoutRestart option on the import page, not for production use, this would be massively helpful for plugin developers.
fields.summary: Import without restart
Update .Net plugin to 2.1.10
Builds that took less than 1 sec to execute should be reported as 'less than a second' instead of 'Unknown'

2009-03-13 06:38:12,677 ERROR [pool-1-thread-2] [TunnelAcceptor] Error while accepting tunnel connections.
java.net.BindException: Address already in use
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketBind(Native Method)
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.bind(PlainSocketImpl.java:359)

java.net.BindException: Address already in use
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketBind(Native Method)
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.bind(PlainSocketImpl.java:359)
	at java.net.ServerSocket.bind(ServerSocket.java:319)
	at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(ServerSocket.java:185)
	at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(ServerSocket.java:97)

	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:675)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:595)
{noformat}

Here is the output of netstat 
{noformat}
# netstat -lnp 
Active Internet connections (only servers)
Proto Recv-Q Send-Q Local Address               Foreign Address             State       PID/Program name   
tcp        0      0 0.0.0.0:1666                0.0.0.0:*                   LISTEN      1771/p4d            
tcp        0      0 :::3690                     :::*                        LISTEN      8909/svnserve       
tcp        0      0 :::4527                     :::*                        LISTEN      1434/java           
tcp        0      0 :::26224                    :::*                        LISTEN      1434/java           
tcp        0      0 :::22                       :::*                        LISTEN      883/sshd            
udp        0      0 0.0.0.0:68                  0.0.0.0:*                               788/dhclient        
Active UNIX domain sockets (only servers)
Proto RefCnt Flags       Type       State         I-Node PID/Program name    Path
unix  2      [ ACC ]     STREAM     LISTENING     2713   866/dbus-daemon     /var/run/dbus/system_bus_socket
# ps -ocmd -p 1434
CMD
java -server -Xms32m -Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -cp /opt/bamboo-elastic-agent/bin/../lib:/opt/bamboo-elastic-agent/bin/../lib/spring-jdbc-2.0.7.jar:/opt/bamboo-elastic-agent/bin/../lib/webwork-2.2.5.jar:/opt
{noformat}

Bamboo elastic agent process has 2 sockets open for listening - 4527 and 26224. When I compare it with the second instance where the startup succeeded I can see that there should be a third socket open - 46593. Probably opening of that socket was the problem. But I cannot see nothing that occupies that port. So maybe it was a hazard between 2 threads of the same app?

Cheers,
Lucas

customize-extras.sh script does not run in correct directory

fields.description:
After working with elastic bamboo for a while on BEAC, I make changes to the volume, generate my new snapshot then shutdown all my agents and start them up with a new volume.  If i do that enough, the volume list in the AWS console will get full and I wont be able to create any more volumes, stopping me from starting any working agents.

Bamboo should delete the volume when it shuts down an agent, it doesn't seam to be doing that.
fields.summary: Shutting down my Elastic Image doesn't delete my ebs volume

fields.description:
With elastic agents you have one agent definition that will be used to run many builds.  That means we will end up with a number of different databases running which will end up clogging up the images quite a bit and probably end up slowing down the builds as more and more databases are added.

What would be really neat is a process that bamboo runs a script on the agent passing in the requirements for the plan that's about to be run.  We could then start the database(s) we need for that build and shut them down when the build is complete.

This could be part of the build itself and done in our maven scripts but it's really a function of the agent, and if done in the build scripts it would end up tying the plan to the agent, which is something that we want to avoid.
fields.summary: Ability to specify a pre and post build command against individual agents or image

fields.description:
Having to SSH in and edit the elastic-agent-capabilities.properties file is painful at best and will be impossible in some situations.  I can imagine some environments where the system administration of the server and the system administration of the bamboo software are performed by different people.

A UI to edit this file and automatically have it reload the changes would be great!
fields.summary: Add UI to edit the elastic agent capabilities so SSH is not required

fields.description:
My company currently has 34 plans configured in Bamboo.

Of these 34 plans, there are only two source repositories.  One Subversion, and one CVS (we are slowly migrating to Subversion).

It would be nice if we could configure those two source repositories (including authentication credentials) once, and then in each plan we would specify a repository and a URL within that repository.  An optional per-plan override for auth credentials would be a nice addition.

This would be particularly nice for us, since our IT guys insist that we change passwords every three months.  We have to go through all 34 plans and change the password, one by one!
fields.summary: Make Source Repositories configurable separately from a build
